footer.text: Open source, free to use. Development inquiries:

events.clickPrepend: The event is triggered by clicking on the `prepend` slot
events.clickPrependInner: The event is triggered by clicking on the `prependInner` slot
events.clickAppend: The event is triggered by clicking on the `append` slot
events.clickAppendInner: The event is triggered by clicking on the `appendInner` slot
events.updateModelValue: The event is triggered when the component needs to change the model. Is also used by `v-model`
events.updateFocused: The event is triggered when the component needs to toggle the focus

props.align: Customizes horizontal position of component (flex based). Available values are strings: 'left', 'center', 'right', 'between', 'around', 'stretch'.
props.id: Applies `id` to internal input component. Useful for native forms.
props.name: Applies `name` to internal input component. Useful for native forms.
props.tag: Replaces html tag. This is useful for semantics and also to allow for valid markup in some cases (`ul > li` and `tr > td` etc.).
props.size: Specify size for component. `"small"`, `"medium"`, `"large"` sizes are available. If you want more control, you can provide number (will be used as `px`) or string value (`rem` and `px` sizes are supported).
props.disabled: Applies `disabled` style and removes all user interaction effects.
props.readonly: Doesn't look disabled, but acts like one. Mostly useful for wrapper components.
props.stateful: Add possibility to work with component without setting `v-model`.
props.color: Color of the component (theme string or *HEX* string).
props.to: The target route of the link. [More info here](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#to "Vue router docs")[[target=_blank]].
props.replace: When set, calls `router.replace()` instead of `router.push()` when navigated, so it will not leave a history record. [More info here](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#replace "Vue router docs")[[target=_blank]].
props.append: When set, always appends the relative path to the current path. [More info here](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#append "Vue router docs")[[target=_blank]].
props.exact: Exactly match the link. Without this, '/' will match every route. [More info here](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#exact "Vue router docs")[[target=_blank]].
props.activeClass: Applied when the link is active. [More info here](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#active-class "Vue router docs")[[target=_blank]].
props.exactActiveClass: Applied when the link is active with exact match. [More info here](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#exact-active-class "Vue router docs")[[target=_blank]].
props.href: Designates the component as anchor and applies the href attribute. [More info here](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#href "Vue router docs")[[target=_blank]].
props.arrayValue: Same as native `value`. It is used with `v-model` of an array type.
props.label: Same as native `label`.
props.leftLabel: Moves the label on the left of a component.
props.loading: Indicates that something is loading (spinner icon).
props.trueValue: Overrides the returned value when it's checked.
props.falseValue: Overrides the returned value when it's not checked.
props.activeButtonTextColor: The color of the text of the active button (options supported by the theme or `HEX`).
props.indeterminate: Same as native `indeterminate` - a state in which it's impossible to say whether the item is toggled `on` or `off`
props.indeterminateValue: Overrides a state value that is not set.
props.borderColor: Color css style `border` (theme supported options or `HEX`).

props.overlap: Allows badge to overlap with element.
props.multiLine: Badge text will wrap to next line.
props.visibleEmpty: Badge will be shown even when there is no text.
props.dot: Shows dot instead of full badge. Useful to notify user without grabbing too much attention.

props.icon: The icon to be displayed to the left of a title
props.iconRight: The icon to be displayed to the right of a title
props.type: Will be used as value for html `type` attribute
props.block: Applies block styling (will take 100% of container width)
props.gradient: Makes the button color a gradient
props.href: Will be used as value for html `href` attribute. (If used, `<button />` will be replaced with `<a>` tag)
props.target: Will be used as value for html `target` attribute (If used, `<button />` will be replaced with `<a>` tag)

events.click: Emitted when user clicks on button

props.autofocus: Focus on first form-component <!-- TODO Add link --> on render

methods.validate: Performs validation and updates error state for each form component. Works with nested forms.
methods.focus: Focus on first focusable form-component in the form.
methods.focusInvalid: Focus on first focusable invalid form-component in the form. This is useful for longer forms and allows to bring user attention to invalid field.
methods.resetValidation: Reset validation for all validateable <!-- TODO Add link --> form-components.
methods.reset: Reset values and validation state for all form-components

props.range: Transforms single value slider into range slider.
props.label: Slider label
props.pins: Adds step marks to a slider track.
props.iconPrepend: Icon at the start of slider.
props.iconAppend: Icon at the end of slider.

slots.label: Replaces the default label.
slots.trackLabel: The content of the `track-label`. Slot scope has access to `value` and `order` (for `range` type) variables.

props.offsetTop: Distance from the top of target element to the top of affixed element.
props.offsetBottom: Distance from the bottom of target element to the bottom of affixed element.
props.target: The element relative to which the component is fixed.

events.change: Emits affixed state on its' change.

props.activeColor: Color of active links (theme string or HEX string).
props.separatorColor: Color of the separator icon (theme string or HEX string).

slots.separator: Separator element. Can be string or vue component.

props.value: The current visibility state of the modal
props.title: Text content to place in the title
props.attachElement: A valid selector of element, where modal will be rendered
props.disableAttachment: Ignore `attach-element` prop and render component as it's parent child
props.size: Set the size of the modal's width. `"small"`, `"medium"` (default) or `"large"`
props.okText: Text string to place in the default footer **Ok** button
props.cancelText: Text string to place in the default footer **Cancel** button
props.hideDefaultActions: Use `hide-default-actions: true` to hide **Cancel** and **Ok** buttons
props.fullscreen: Add the `fullscreen` prop to cover the whole page
props.mobileFullscreen: Use `mobile-fullscreen: false` to disable fullscreen mode for mobile viewports
props.noDismiss: Disable both close on overlay click and close on **Esc**
props.maxWidth: Use `max-width` to change the maximum width of the modal.
props.maxHeight: Use `max-height` to change the maximum height of the modal. If content is larger, scroll will appear
props.fixedLayout: Use `fixed-layout: true` to scroll only content in modal. Title and actions will be fixed
props.withoutTransitions: Use `without-transitions: true` to turn off the open and close animations on the modal
props.overlay: Use `overlay: false` to hide the overlay

events.input: Emits when modal's visibility should change
events.beforeOpen: Emits before modal's open after transition started
events.open: Emits when modal's is open and transition is complete
events.beforeClose: Emits before modal's start closing after transition started
events.close: Emits when modal's is closed and transition is complete
events.cancel: Emits when the user closes the modal window without side effects

methods.hide: Hide modal. On stateless modal only emits `input`
methods.open: Show modal. On stateless modal only emits `input`
methods.toggle: Toggle a modal's visibility. On stateless modal only emits `input`

props.icon: The icon displayed when icon is filled
props.halfIcon: The icon displayed when icon is half-filled (requires **`halves`**)
props.emptyIcon: The icon displayed when icon is empty (requires **`halves`**)
props.readonly: Disables all user interaction effects (pointer, hover)
props.numbers: When `true`, numbers from 1 to **`max`** are rendered instead of icons
props.halves: Allow to select half of the item
props.max: The amount of items to display
props.clearable: Allows the components value to be set to 0. Triggered by clicking on currently selected icon
props.hover: Adds visual feedback when hovering on items
props.texts: The array of captions to be used with each value. The array length should be equal to **`max`** prop
props.unselectedColor: Specifies the color of unselected items (by default **`color`** prop is used)

props.value: Current page (or item if `total` is issued) value
props.visiblePages: The amount of displayed pages. (When set to 0 all pages are displayed)
props.boundaryLinks: Show controls to move to first and last page
props.boundaryNumbers: Always show first and last page (will replace `boundary-links` if both used)
props.directionLinks: Show buttons to move forward and backward
props.input: Use HTML Input instead of buttons to control `va-pagination` state
props.hideOnSinglePage: Component won't be displayed if only 1 page is available
props.total: Set the amount of data pagination should iterate through. This prop should not be used with `pages` prop.
props.pageSize: Set the amount of data to be displayed at 1 page. Used to calculate the length of pagination. This prop should not be used with `pages` prop.
props.boundaryIconLeft: Set the icon name for left boundary icon
props.boundaryIconRight: Set the icon name for right boundary icon
props.directionIconLeft: Set the icon name for left direction icon
props.directionIconRight: Set the icon name for right direction icon
props.size: Specify size for component. "small", "medium", "large" sizes are available

props.value: The *name* of selected tab or *index* (if `name` prop is not specified)
props.left: Align all items to the left
props.right: Align all items to the right
props.center: Align all items to the center
props.hideSlider: Remove slider which underlines selected item
props.prevIcon: Icon to be used for scrolling backward in pagination
props.nextIcon: Icon to be used for scrolling forward in pagination

props.size: Specify size for component. `"small"`, `"medium"`, `"large"` sizes are available
props.label: Switch label
props.arrayValue: Takes the value of a switch in an array of switches

props.type: Specify the format of component. Supported types are `single`, `list` and `gallery`

events.input: Emits hover state when it changes.

props.dashed: If set to true, the divider line is dashed
props.inset: If set to true, the left and right margins will be added; reduces height for vertical divider
props.orientation: Position of the title inside divider (for horizontal only). `left`, `center` (default) or `right`

props.title: Sets the title for the notification
props.customClass: Applies custom class to the component
props.duration: Sets the duration of the notification display
props.closeable: Provides the ability to close the component
props.onClose: Applies a function to use when pressed a close button
props.onClick: Applies a function to use when clicked
props.position: Sets the position of the notification
props.render: Render function to use a custom content
props.multiLine: Sets more space for the Toast component
props.html: Sets the ability to use `message` as innerHtml. **Please note that this can lead to XSS attacks**, so make sure that you sanitize the `message` by yourself

events.onClose: Emits when close button is clicked

props.stripe: Displays a stripe above a card title.
props.stripeColor: Customize stripe color (theme string or *HEX* string).
props.bordered: Toggles borders of a card component.
props.dark: Applies dark color and background to card

props.width: Width of component in maximized state.
props.minimizedWidth: Width of component in minimized state.

props.contain: Scales the image while maintaining the proportions so that the whole image fits inside the block.

events.loaded: Emitted when image loading is finished.

slots.error: Is shown if loading gives an error.
slots.default: Image overlay for you to add content. Doesn't show on loading or error.

props.value: The array of currently selected items in a list
props.disabledBy: Specify the key in the object to be used as item `disabled` prop. Can be string (path to the key) or function of type: `(option) => option.disabled`
props.valueBy: Specify the key in the object to be used as item `value` prop. Can be string (path to the key) or function of type: `(option) => option.value`
props.trackBy: Specify the key in the object to be used as item `key` prop. Can be string (path to the key) or function of type: `(option) => option.track`
props.textBy: Specify the key in the object to be used as item `text` prop. Can be string (path to the key) or function of type: `(option) => option.text`
props.options: The array of items to be displayed
props.type: Specify the format of component. Supported types are `"radio"`, `"checkbox"` and `"switch"`
props.defaultValue: This value will be pre-selected when component mounts
props.leftLabel: Put the labels to the left

slots.default:
Used to render items. Available props are:
`option: String `|` Object`,
`isDisabled: Boolean`,
`name: String`,
`color: String`,
`leftLabel: Boolean`,
`getText: (option: String `|` Object) => String`,
`selectedValue: Array<String `|` Object>`,
`index: Number`

props.icon: The icon to be displayed inside a container
props.src: URL to the image (will be placed inside `src` attribute of image tag)
props.fontSize: The font-size of text inside avatar

slots.default: Use this slot to replace default content to be displayed inside the component

events.input: Emitted when the component needs to change the value

props.buffer: Create a loading bar with a buffer. Commonly used in videos
props.rounded: Add a border radius to the `va-progress-bar` component (default: true)

slots.default: Display any additional info about the progress

props.indeterminate: Using the `indeterminate` prop, the `va-progress-circle` continues to  animate indefinitely.

slots.default: Display any additional info about the progress

props.offset: Number of pixels to the end of `va-infinite-scroll` container at which the component should start loading more content in advance.
props.reverse: Instead of bottom, top of the container would trigger loading.
props.disabled: Won't trigger load even when scroll reached end. Useful to prevent further loading when there is no more items in list.
props.scrollTarget: The element to be used as a scroll container instead of default one. Could be CSS selector or Element. When not set - direct wrapper will be used as a scroll container.
props.debounce: Debounce to be applied when listening to scroll event. Useful to prevent user from triggering loading multiple times.
props.load: Function that loads data. Should return Promise
props.tag: Replaces html tag. This is useful for semantics and also to allow for valid markup in some cases (`ul > li` and `tr > td` etc.).

events.onload: Emits when `load` function finished with success

props.value: The current visibility state of the alert
props.title: The text content placed in the title
props.description: The text content of the alert
props.icon: Show icon in front of alert content
props.closeIcon: Replace the default close icon with a custom one
props.closeText: Use text instead of the close icon
props.center: Center the title and description of the alert
props.border: Stripe border for alert. `top`, `right`, `bottom`, `left` sizes are available

methods.hide: Hide alert. On stateless alert only emits `input`

props.component: Allows to use the `svg` component as an icon
props.rotation: Rotates a component by a degree value
props.flip: Specifies mirror image relative to horizontal and vertical planes. `"off"`, `"horizontal"`, `"vertical"` and `"both"` values are available

props.option: Option value that model is updated to when an option is selected

props.header: Text content to place in the header
props.icon: The icon to be displayed inside a header
props.colorAll: Applies color to collapse contents background

slots.header: Replaces content of the header to custom

props.value: The array of currently opened collapses

events.input: Emits when any of collapses is clicked

props.closeable: Provides the ability to close the tag
props.icon: The icon to be displayed inside a tag

props.label: Sets input label
props.mask: Sets input mask if using as string or options for mask
props.removable: Adds an button that clears the value
props.returnRaw: Sets possibility to return raw value
props.autosize: Sets textarea possibility to grow up automatically and disables the ability to this to the user (set css `resize: none`)
props.rules: Accepts an array of functions that take an input value as an argument and return either true / false or a string with an error message
props.messages: Displays a list of messages or message if using a string
props.errorMessages: Displays a list of error messages or message if using a string
props.clearable: Adds a button to reset the input field value
props.clearValue: Sets value that should be set after clearing
props.canBeFocused: If false, then input can not be focused using mouse or keyboard
props.requiredMark: Adds required mark to the label
props.immediateValidation: Sets the validation to be performed when the component is mounted
props.pattern: The pattern prop specifies a regular expression the input value should match
props.inputmode: The inputmode prop is an enumerated prop that hints at the type of data that might be entered by the user while editing the element or its contents. This alows a browser to display an apropriate virtual keyboard

events.change: Emitted when the input loose focus or on `enter`
events.blur: Emitted when the input is blurred
events.click: Emitted when user clicked on input
events.keyup: Emitted when the user releases a key on the keyboard
events.keydown: Emitted when any key is pressed
events.keypress: Emitted when any key is pressed. The event is deprecated, will be removed in future versions
events.clickIcon: Emitted when user clicked on icon
events.updateError: Emitted when was changed error status after validation
events.updateErrorMessages: Emitted when was changed error messages after validation

slots.prepend: Adds an item outside the input and before input content
slots.prependInner: Adds an item inside the input and before input content
slots.append: Adds an item outside the input and after input content
slots.appendInner: Adds an item inside the input and after input content
slots.messages: Replaces messages under input field with slot content

props.fit: Stretches list by its content width
Adds space on the left side
props.spaced: Adds spaces over and under the separator

events.click: Emitted when user clicked on item

props.caption: Applies another style to text
props.lines: Divides item label content on a custom count of lines

props.value: Model of the component. Must be Array if using 'multiple' prop
props.clearValue: Sets value that should be set after clearing
props.options: Available options that the user can select from
props.disabledBy: Specify the key in the object to be used as item `disabled` prop. Can be string (path to the key) or function of type: `(option) => option.disabled`
props.valueBy: Specify the key in the object to be used as item `value` prop. Can be string (path to the key) or function of type: `(option) => option.value`
props.trackBy: Specify the key in the object to be used as item `key` prop. Can be string (path to the key) or function of type: `(option) => option.track`
props.textBy: Specify the key in the object to be used as item `text` prop. Can be string (path to the key) or function of type: `(option) => option.text`
props.groupBy: Specify the key in the object to be used as item `group` prop. Can be string (path to the key) or function of type: `(option) => option.group`
props.placeholder: Sets the placeholder text to input
props.tagMax: Sets maximum tag count after whom selection will be cropped
props.searchable: Sets ability to filter option list by typing
props.maxSelections: Sets the maximum amount of selected options
props.noOptionsText: Sets text whom displaying if list have no items
props.hideSelected: Sets ability to hide selected options
props.allowCreate: Allow creating new options. Can be set to `unique` if you want to create only unique options
props.dropdownIcon: Sets the dropdown icon. Can be object if you want to sets different open/close icons
props.requiredMark: Adds required mark to the label

events.clear: Emitted if select value has been cleared
events.updateSearch: Emitted if search value has changed
events.createNew: Emitted if search input has created new option
events.scrollBottom: Emitted once the scroll position of options has reached the bottom

slots.prepend: Adds an item outside the input and before input content
slots.prependInner: Adds an item inside the input and before input content
slots.append: Adds an item outside the input and after input content
slots.appendInner: Adds an item inside the input and after input content
slots.content: Adds an item instead the input

props.target: The element relative to which the component is fixed
props.alt: Specifies an alternate text for an image
props.height: Sets a height of the parallax
props.speed: Sets a speed of the parallax scrolling

slots.default: For a content over the parallax

props.target: Applies the selector to which the backtop is bound
props.visibilityHeight: The minimum height after which the backtop is displayed
props.horizontalPosition: Sets the horizontal position of the component
props.verticalPosition: Sets the vertical position of the component
props.horizontalOffset: Sets the horizontal offset of the component from the border of the monitor
props.verticalOffset: Sets the vertical offset of the component from the border of the monitor

events.click: Emitted when user clicked on backtop

props.size: Specify size for component. `"small"`, `"medium"`, `"large"` sizes are available.
props.round: Sets the square style for a button.
props.split: Divides the button into two parts. This is useful when you have main action (button) and a number of secondary actions (icon + dropdown).
props.splitTo: Sets a vue navigation link in a split component.
props.splitHref: Sets a native navigation link in a split component.
props.icon: Applies a custom icon in the dropdown section.
props.leftIcon: Sets the icon position to the left
props.openedIcon: Applies a custom icon in the dropdown section when the dropdown is opened.
props.position: Sets the position of the dropdown content.
props.offset: Sets the distance between dropdown and anchor.
props.closeOnContentClick: Sets dropdown content on click behavior.

events.click: Emitted when user clicks on button.
events.mainButtonClick: Emitted when user clicks on main button in split component.

props.items: Array of objects with table data (`ITableItem: Record<string, any>`). The `va-data-table` automatically calculates the amount and the titles of columns (if not specified otherwise with the `columns` prop) based on these object's keys. When calculating the columns' names based on the item's objects' keys `va-data-table` uses [Lodash's startCase](https://lodash.com/docs/4.17.15#startCase)[[target=_blank]] internally. Faulty values are replaced with an empty string
props.filter: If a `filter` is provided, only rows in which at least one cell contains the specified value will be displayed. To disable filtering at runtime (clear `filter`), specify an empty string
props.filterMethod: A custom filtering function. The function takes the initial value of the currently checked cell (the `source` is a formal parameter) and should return a `boolean` value, indicating whether to include the row containing this cell or not
props.sortBy: Sets the column to sort by. Works through the `v-model`
props.sortingOrder: Sets the sorting order. Works through the `v-model`
props.selectable: Sets whether the `va-data-table` should have selectable rows or not
props.clickable: Sets whether the `va-data-table` should have clickable (the click events will be emitted) rows or not
props.selectMode: Sets the select mode. `'single'` selection allows for only a single row to be selected at a time, while `'multiple'` mode allows to select multiple rows by clicking on checkboxes or using the **ctrl**/**shift** keys when clicking rows
props.selectedColor: Sets the highlighting color of the selected row
props.perPage: Sets the maximum number of rows displayed in the table's `<tbody>`
props.currentPage: Sets the number of the current table page
props.loading: Sets the loading state for the table (by displaying the spinning loading-indicator)
props.loadingColor: Sets the color of the spinning loading-indicator
props.noDataHtml: Sets html-content for cases where there are no items passed in the `items` option at all
props.noDataFilteredHtml: Sets html-content for cases where there are no items found when filtering the table using the `filter` prop
props.hideDefaultHeader: Sets whether to show the default headers for columns
props.footerClone: Sets whether to clone the `<thead>` columns into the `<tfoot>`. Has no effect if the default `<thead>` is hidden with the `hide-default-header` prop
props.allowFooterSorting: Allows clicks on `<tfoot>` column headers to sort (and to display the sorting status) the rows
props.striped: Sets the striped style to the `<tbody>` rows (highlights each 2nd row)
props.hoverable: Allows the hover state on table rows within a `<tbody>`. The highlighting color of the hover state takes from `selected-color` prop
props.stickyHeader: Enables sticky header (sticky header is achieved through CSS with `position: sticky` for `thead`)
props.height: Sets the height to the table and enables scrolling

events.sorted:
Each time the table's sorting changes, the `sorted` event is thrown, with the following param: `SortedEmit` = 
 {
   `sortBy: string`,
   `sortingOrder: TSortingOrder`,
   `items: ITableItem[]`,
   `itemsIndexes: number[]`
 }
events.rowDblclick: Double-clicking a row raises an event with the `RowClickEmit` param
events.rowContextmenu: When the context menu is clicked on a row, an event is raised with the `RowClickEmit` param

slots.colgroup: The contents of this slot is wrapped (if provided) inside the `<colgroup>` tag, allowing to specify certain column options. Bound to columns (not the prop, but their internal representation)
slots.headerPrepend: Prepends custom rows in table header (`<thead>`). Isn't bound to anything
slots.header: Targets all the table headings. Is bound to columns (to their internal representation)
slots.headerKey: Targets a specific table header by the column's `key`. Is bound to column
slots.headerAppend: Appends custom rows inside table header (`<thead>`)
slots.cell: Targets all the cells. Is bound to the current cell (to it internal representation)
slots.cellKey: Allows to target only cells of a specified by the given `key` column. Is bound to the current cell
slots.footer: Targets all the headers inside `<tfoot>`. Works if there's a `footer-clone` prop set to `true`
slots.footerKey: A specific header in `<tfoot>`. Is bound to the column (to it internal representation) with the given `key`. Works if there's a `footer-clone` prop set to `true`

props.modelValue: Date, date array or date period
props.firstWeekday: Name of first weekday. Can be `Monday` or `Sunday`
props.hideWeekDays: Hide weekday names on top of day picker
props.view: This prop specify which year and month will be shown to user. Also, you can specify type and show year, month or day picker
props.type: This prop will specify which value user should choose
props.showOtherMonths: If `true`, other month days will be shown in day picker
props.highlightToday: If `true` today date will be colored
props.allowedDays: Function that accepts date and return `false` if day is not allowed
props.allowedMonths: Function that accepts date and return `false` if month is not allowed
props.allowedYears: Function that accepts date and return `false` if year is not allowed
props.weekends: Function that accepts date and return `true` if date is weekend
props.startYear: First year that user can choose. By default is 1970
props.endYear: Last year that user can choose. By default is current year plus 50 years
props.weekendsColor: Color of the weekend cells (theme string or HEX string).
props.mode: Specify if picker value is single date, multiple dates or date range.

events.updateView: Emit when DatePicker "view type" is changed. DatePicker view types are `"day"`, `"month"`, `"year"`.
events.hoverYear: The event is triggered when the mouse hover the year cell.
events.clickYear: The event is triggered when clicked the year cell.
events.hoverDay: The event is triggered when the mouse hover the day cell.
events.clickDay: The event is triggered when clicked the day cell.
events.hoverMonth: The event is triggered when the mouse hover the month cell.
events.clickMonth: The event is triggered when clicked the month cell.

slots.buttonPrev: Button show previous month or year.
slots.buttonNext: Button show next month or year.
slots.header: This slot is showing year and month between header buttons.
slots.year: Used to change how year will be displayed in header and picker cell.
slots.month: Used to change how month will be displayed in header and picker cell.
slots.weekday: Used to change how weekday will be displayed in picker cell.
slots.day: Used to change how day will be displayed in picker cell.

props.modelValue: Date, date array or date period
props.config: Object with settings for date picker
props.firstWeekday: Name of first weekday. Can be `Monday` or `Sunday`
props.hideWeekDays: Hide weekday names on top of day picker
props.view: This prop specify which year and month will be shown to user. Also, you can specify type and show year, month or day picker
props.type: This prop will specify which value user should choose
props.showOtherMonths: If `true`, other month days will be shown in day picker
props.highlightToday: If `true` today date will be colored
props.allowedDays: Function that accepts date and return `false` if day is not allowed
props.allowedMonths: Function that accepts date and return `false` if month is not allowed
props.allowedYears: Function that accepts date and return `false` if year is not allowed
props.weekends: Function that accepts date and return `true` if date is weekend
props.startYear: First year that user can choose. By default is 1970
props.endYear: Last year that user can choose. By default is current year plus 50 years
props.weekendsColor: Color of the weekend cells (theme string or HEX string).
props.mode: Specify if picker value is single date, multiple dates or date range.
props.clearable: Adds a button to reset the input field value
props.format: Function that accepts picker value and should transform it to text for input
props.isOpen: Value for dropdown. If `true`, then dropdown is shown
props.resetOnClose: If true, range value will be reset to previous valid value
props.label: Sets input label
props.mask: Sets input mask if using as string or options for mask
props.removable: Adds an button that clears the value
props.returnRaw: Sets possibility to return raw value
props.autosize: Sets textarea possibility to grow up automatically
props.rules: Accepts an array of functions that take an input value as an argument and return either true / false or a string with an error message
props.messages: Displays a list of messages or message if using a string
props.errorMessages: Displays a list of error messages or message if using a string
props.manualInput: Allows user to manually input date in VaInput

events.updateView: The event is triggered when the component needs to change the view
events.updateMonth: The event is triggered when the component needs to change the month
events.updateYear: The event is triggered when the component needs to change the year
events.updateIsOpen: The event is triggered when the component needs to toggle the 'is-open'
events.updateText: The event is triggered when the component needs to change the input text
events.hoverDay: The event is triggered when the mouse hover the day cell
events.hoverMonth: The event is triggered when the mouse hover the month cell
events.clickDay: The event is triggered when clicked the day cell
events.clickMonth: The event is triggered when clicked the month cell

props.options: The array of objects with `label` and `value` properties
props.size: Specify size for component. "small", "medium", "large" sizes are available
props.activeButtonTextColor: The color of the button text with the selected value

events.input: Emits when toggling to the different button

props.bottom: Sets the component position to the bottom
props.shadowOnScroll: Applies box-shadow to the component when scrolling target

slots.default: Slot for the component to which you want to apply loading styles

props.activeColor: Used to set accent color for active `VaSidebarItem`
props.hoverColor: Used to set accent color for hovered `VaSidebarItem`
props.active: If `true` this sidebar item will be highlighted

props.shape: If this prop true, then shape will be drawn at navbar background.

props.title: Sets the title of the popover
props.message: Message which showed in a popover
props.trigger: Event on which popover is triggered
props.autoHide: Adds the ability to hide popover when clicked outside

props.hoursFilter: Function that allows you to hide some specific hours
props.minutesFilter: Function that allows you to hide some specific minutes
props.secondsFilter: Function that allows you to hide some specific seconds
props.view: View specifying which columns will be shown
props.periodUpdatesModelValue: If user will change period it will automatically update model value. You can turn off it and am/pm switch will only change view.

props.hoursFilter: Function that allows you to hide some specific hours
props.minutesFilter: Function that allows you to hide some specific minutes
props.secondsFilter: Function that allows you to hide some specific seconds
props.view: View specifying which columns will be shown
props.periodUpdatesModelValue: If user will change period it will automatically update model value. You can turn off it and am/pm switch will only change view.
props.format: Custom function that format model value as input text
props.parse: Custom function that parses text from VaInput
props.manualInput: Allows user to manually input date in VaInput
props.isOpen: Value for dropdown. If `true`, then dropdown is shown
props.label: Sets input label
props.mask: Sets input mask if using as string or options for mask
props.removable: Adds an button that clears the value
props.returnRaw: Sets possibility to return raw value
props.clearValue: Sets value that should be set after clearing
props.autosize: Sets textarea possibility to grow up automatically
props.rules: Accepts an array of functions that take an input value as an argument and return either true / false or a string with an error message
props.messages: Displays a list of messages or message if using a string
props.errorMessages: Displays a list of error messages or message if using a string
props.clearable: Adds a button to reset the input field value
props.canBeFocused: If false, then input can not be focused using mouse or keyboard
props.icon: Sets an icon. The default icon position is on the right
props.requiredMark: Adds required mark to the label
props.leftIcon: Sets the icon position to the left

props.arrows: Show or hide next and previous button.
props.autoscrollInterval: Time in `ms`. Each `autoscroll-interval` next slide will be shown.
props.autoscrollPauseDuration: Pause animation duration in `ms` after user changed slide.
props.height: Slider height. Can be any valid CSS height.
props.indicatorTrigger: Event which will trigger indicator to change slide
props.indicators: Show or hide indicators at the bottom of slider
props.infinite: If true, after last slide first will be shown.
props.items: List of slide items. Can be any array. By default should be a image src, but you can use item later in `default` slot.
props.loop: If true, after last slide slider will scroll to first one through all items before.
props.fadeKeyframe: Custom keyframe name for fade animation

slots.default: Custom style for slide item content

npmScripts.generateFilesForComponent: Generate all needed files for component (component itself, docs, tests)

documentationPage.title: Documentation Page
documentationPage.description: This page is intended for Vuestic-UI contributors. It explains the ways to create and modify the documentation.

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.description: Instead of using the established documentation system, such as [vue-press](https://vuepress.vuejs.org/)[[target=_blank]] or [docsify](https://docsify.js.org/#/)[[target=_blank]], we decided to build a system specifically tailored for Vuestic. It’s meant to provide an excellent flexibility for the future growth.

pageConfig.title: Page Config
pageConfig.descriptionStructure: The page configuration must be located in a specific path, which is similar to the page URL. The folder with the page configuration must include the `components` folders for blocks with components and` examples` for blocks with examples. These folders should contain the `* .vue` files. An example of the structure and directory of the configuration folder for the current page:
pageConfig.descriptionFile: The configuration file contains `config`, which is an array of page blocks that perform specific functions.

generators.title: Generators
generators.description: We have created custom generators to facilitate and automate the creation of new pages..
generators.generateDocsPage: * The `yarn generate:docspage` command will generate a page with the specified name in the category selected from the list..
generators.generateComponent: * The `yarn generate:component` command will generate a complete structure for a new component: create a component, connect it to a library, make a configuration file for it, and add a clean example to the examples folder.

blocktypes.title: Block Types
blocktypes.descriptionHelper: The documentation has a flat structure - a list of blocks. To use blocks, you need to create an object of the `PageGenerationHelper` class, passing the path to the current folder to the constructor. After creating the object, call the methods that will return the required block.
blocktypes.description: Translation strings are structured in a flat manner — just a list of blocks. Markdown is supported for all the text blocks. Here is the list of blocks you can use:

titleBlock.title: Title
titleBlock.text: Page title is **mandatory** for documentation pages.

subtitle.title: Subtitle
subtitle.text: Used for examples, API, FAQ. Think `h2`.

headline.title: Headline
headline.text: The `headline` block is used to mark the titles of examples and the FAQs. Think `h3`.

paragraph.title: Paragraph
paragraph.text: Should be used for all the regular text blocks. For links to external resources you can specify the **target** attribute in markdown markup as follows: `[name](href)[[target=_blank]]`.
paragraph.example: Paragraph (example). Link in the text leading to an external resource: [markdown-it-attrs](https://github.com/arve0/markdown-it-attrs)[[target=_blank]].

list.title: List
list.inCode: Here's the resulting markup for the code above:

code.title: Code
code.text: For the code previews we use [prism](https://prismjs.com/)[[target=_blank]].

example.title: Example
example.text: Shows a component with code preview. Component can use all global services: css classes, colors etc. Mostly used in the ui-elements section to show examples of use.

component.title: Component
component.text: Shows a component that has some logic and is not an example of use.

api.title: API
api.text: The API-documentation for a component. Combines component options with manual declarations.

table.title: Table
table.text: Used to display tabular data. Requires a flat column-definitions array and yet another two-dimensional-array with the actual cells' data.

link.title: Link
link.text: Used for relative (local) links processed by the router (with *options* or without them).

alert.title: Alert
alert.text: Used to display an important message.

apiOptions.text: We can't go too far with the help of automated code analysis. Most of the API documentation has to be declared explicitly. API options allow you to configure things such as: version, props, events, methods and slots.
apiOptions.version: `version` - specifies the version of Vuestic UI that this component or feature has been introduced at.
apiOptions.types: `types` - the documentation engine can automatically infer simple prop types (such as `String`, `Number`, etc.) right from the component options. Almost any other type should be defined explicitly.
apiOptions.hidden: `hidden` - allows you to hide the prop from the API section of the documentation page. Might become quite useful for some props which are intended for internal use solely.

avatar.title: Avatar
avatar.summaryText: `va-avatar` component is typically used for user profile pictures. The component  helps you display it in different sizes consistently throughout your web application.

default.title: Default
default.text: By default `va-avatar` is displayed as a circle container.

size.title: Different sizes
size.text: The `size` prop prop allows you to specify custom size for an avatar. By default, font size will be scaled depending on the value of the `size` prop. But you can use the `font-size` prop prop to force text size you need.

withImage.title: With images
withImage.text: The `src` prop prop is used to add custom icons to a component.

withIcon.title: With icons
withIcon.text: The `icon` prop is used to display icons inside an avatar.

affix.title: Affix
affix.summaryText: The affix component is created to fix any content in a proper position relative to a container.

target.title: Fixes element relative to custom container

breadcrumbs.title: Breadcrumbs
breadcrumbs.text: The breadcrumbs component is used for application navigation. It shows the location of the current page within the navigation hierarchy. It’s used with `va-breadcrumb-item` components.

default.title: Default
default.text: This is a basic usage of the `va-breadcrumbs` component.

align.title: Align
align.text: Changes component position on the page.

separator.title: Separator
separator.text: You can use your own separator and customize its color.

questions.question: Can `separator` prop work with `separator` slot?
questions.answer: No, slot has higher priority, prop is ignored when slot is used. Same is legit for `label` of `va-breadcrumbs-item`, it is ignored when you use `default` slot.

badge.title: Badge
badge.summaryText: VaBadge is used to highlight information related to other element, such as missed notifications on top of avatar.

default.title: Default
default.text: Useful for information views and tables.

button.title: Button
button.summaryText: The `va-button` component replaces the standard HTML button. It offers multiple built-in styles and allows a user to change color and size manually.

default.title: Default
default.text: Just a simple button.

withColor.title: Colors
withColor.text: The `color` prop is used to change the color of the component.

withGradient.title: Gradient
withGradient.text: It’s used to apply a gradient style to a background.

withTextColor.title: Text colors
withTextColor.text: The `text-color` prop is used to change the color of the button text.

withSize.title: Sizes
withSize.text: The `size` prop is used to fit your button to any place on your web page.

withIcon.title: Add icons
withIcon.text: You can add icons to `va-button` with 2 different props: `icon` and `icon-right`

withConfig.title: Icons as slots with config
withConfig.text: You can wrap your buttons with `VaConfig` and pass icons as slots

withLoading.title: Loading state
withLoading.text: You can add loading state to the button

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.text: The `disabled` prop prevent any actions with button.

slider.title: Slider
slider.summaryText: The slider component is a visualization for the number input. A user can drag a slider within a fixed range to get the required value.

default.title: Default
default.text: This is basic usage of the slider component.

color.title: Color
color.text: You can customize the color of the slider.

minmax.title: Minimum and maximum values
minmax.text: You can set a range between min and max values.

state.title: State
state.text: Slider can be in disabled or readonly state.

range.title: Range slider
range.text: You can set a range of values.

label.title: Label
label.text: Switch label can have an inverted position or a custom color.

slots.title: Slots
slots.text: You can add inputs before and after the slider using 'append' or 'prepend' slot name. Also default label can be replaced using 'label' slot.

icon.title: Icon
icon.text: You can insert icon at the start or end of slider.

track.title: Track
track.text: Track can be hidden or have custom color.

trackLabel.title: Track label
trackLabel.text: You can show track label and overwrite it's view.

switch.title: Switch
switch.summaryText: Switch component turns on or off the state of your custom option

default.title: Default
default.text: This is basic usage of switch component.

state.title: State
state.text: Switch can be in disabled or readonly state.

label.title: Label
label.text: Switch can be labeled on the left or on the right.

customLabel.title: Custom Label
customLabel.text: You can label any state of switch.

innerLabel.title: Inner Label
innerLabel.text: You may put a label inside of a switch.

loading.title: Loading
loading.text: You can mark a pending state of switch.

customValue.title: Custom Values
customValue.text: You can set custom values for true and false state of the component.

rating.title: Rating
rating.summaryText: The `va-rating` component is a simple yet powerful element when it comes to gathering users feedback. Just in a few lines of code it can provide you with users ratings about your product or application.

default.title: Default
default.text: The `va-rating` component has a simple interface to collect user feedback.

color.title: Colors
color.text: With `color` prop you can change the color of the component.

size.title: Sizes
size.text: Using `size` prop specify custom size for an `va-rating` component.

hover.title: Hover
hover.text: By using `hover` prop you can see visual changes of value before click.

halves.title: Halves
halves.text: You can divide your `va-rating` component values on halves.

texts.title: Texts
texts.text: A component can be covered by different custom labels for each value.

clearable.title: Clearable
clearable.text: Selecting current value again will clear the component.

numbers.title: Numbers
numbers.text: Want to see numbers instead of icons? We got you covered.

customIcons.title: Custom Icons
customIcons.text: Providing this prop to component allows you to add custom icons.

questions.question: Is rating component keyboard accessible?
questions.answer: Yes, you can use `Tab` `(Shift+Tab)` to move between icons and press Enter to submit value. Or you can use arrow keys (Left and Right) to change rating value

questions.question: Can I use every other prop in combination with **numbers** prop?
questions.answer: Yes, all props are compatible between each other.

toast.title: Toast
toast.summaryText: Component for sending a notification to the user. To make it easier to create toast we have a shorthands. For options API it is `$vaToast`. For composition api we have `useToast` hook. Hook and global object have similar API.
toast.optionsAPI: In options API you can use ToastPlugin (automatically installed with VuesticPlugin). `$vaToast` have a few methods: init, close, closeAll.
toast.compositionAPI: In composition API you can use `useToast` hook.

default.title: Basic usage
default.text: By default, run this component in events by using the `init` method with a setting object.

color.title: Color
color.text: Set different colors using `color` prop. You can either user theme string *HEX* color value.

offset.title: Offset
offset.text: Use `offset` property to set the offset of the toast.

position.title: Position
position.text: Use `position` property to set the custom position of the toast. Available are `top-right`, `top-left`, `bottom-right`, `bottom-left`.

close.title: Close
close.text: You can use close method to close the notification and you can set custom onClose event.

click.title: Click
click.text: You can set custom onClick event to handle the click on button.

questions.question: What is the difference between a component and a service?
questions.answer:
The difference is in implementation. The service behaves more flexibly and it is easier to bind it to certain events than to render the whole element. 
 Each prop you provide to the component you can provide to the service too by using the setting object.

modal.title: Modal
modal.summaryText: Classic modal overlay which represents a dialog box or other interactive component, such as a dismissible alert, sub-window, etc.

overview.title: Overview
overview.text:
`<va-modal>`, by default, has the **OK** and **Cancel** buttons in the footer. You can provide a custom message and title with the `message` and `title` props respectively.

`<va-modal>` supports close on **Esc** (enabled by default) and close on overlay click (enabled by default). These features may be disabled by setting the props `no-esc-dismiss` and `no-outside-dismiss` respectively, or `no-dismiss` as a shorthand to disable both of them.

stateful.title: Stateful
stateful.text: By default `va-modal` is stateless. You can change it by setting the `stateful` prop

fullscreen.title: Full screen
fullscreen.text:
Add the `fullscreen` prop to cover the whole page.

Note that `va-modal` is full screen on mobile viewports by default. You can change it by setting the `mobile-fullscreen` prop to `false`.

modalSizing.title: Modal sizing
modalSizing.text: Modals have three optional sizes, available via the prop `size`. These sizes kick in at certain breakpoints to avoid horizontal scrollbars on narrower viewports. Valid optional sizes are `small`, `medium` (default), and `large`.

toggleVisibility.title: Toggle modal visibility
toggleVisibility.text: There are several methods that you can employ to toggle the visibility of `<va-modal>`.

sections.title: Using `v-model` property
sections.text: `v-model` property is always automatically synced with `<va-modal>` visible state and you can show/hide using `v-model`.

sections.title: Using `show()`, `hide()`, and `toggle()` component methods
sections.text: You can access modal using `ref` attribute and then call the `show()`, `hide()` or `toggle()` methods.

disableAnimation.title: Disable open and close animation
disableAnimation.text: To disable the transition/animation when modal opens and closes, set the prop `without-transitions`.

hidingOverlay.title: Hiding the overlay
hidingOverlay.text:
Hide the modal's overlay via setting the `overlay` prop to `false`.

Note that clicking outside of the modal will still close the modal even though the overlay is hidden. You can disable this behaviour by setting the `no-outside-dismiss` prop on `<va-modal>`.

scrollingLongContent.title: Scrolling long content
scrollingLongContent.text:
When modals become too long for the user's viewport or device, they allow the scrolling of the modal body. Try the demo below to see what we mean.

You can also allow scrolling only content in modal via setting the `fixed-layout` prop. Title and actions will be fixed.

customization.title: Customization
customization.text:
`<va-modal>` provides several slots (`default`, `header` and `footer`), that you can use to customize the content of various sections of the modal.

You can set custom text for **Cancel** and **Ok** buttons via `ok-text` and `cancel-text` props respectively, or you can hide them via `hide-default-actions` prop.

`va-modal` also supports custom `overlay-opacity` as well as `z-index`, `max-width` and `max-height` for a modal.

nestedModals.title: Nested modals
nestedModals.text: Modals can be nested: you can open one modal from another.

pagination.title: Pagination
pagination.summaryText: The pagination component is used to split big data sets into chunks so that it's simpler for users to use provided information.

default.title: Default
default.text: By default the component is displayed as a list of pages with length equal to `pages` prop value.

colors.title: Color
colors.text: Set different colors using `color` prop. You can either user theme string *HEX* color value

sizes.title: Size
sizes.text: Utilize `size` prop in order to make component fit your needs. Refer to *API* section for more in-depth explanation of how to use `size` prop.

icons.title: Custom icons
icons.text: Feeling the need to change icons for arrows? We have 4 props to enable full customization of `va-pagination` component.

limitVisible.title: Limiting the length
limitVisible.text: By using `visible-pages` prop you can set the amount of pages visible on screen.

withInput.title: Using HTML input instead of pages
withInput.text: With `input` prop you can have input with arrow buttons instead of default pagination.

totalAndPageSize.title: Using `total` and `page-size`
totalAndPageSize.text: You can provide `total` and `page-size` props to `va-pagination` component and let it calculate the length of pagination itself. The value of the component in this case would be equal to the number of the first item at the selected page.

questions.question: What will happen if both `pages` and `total` props are set?
questions.answer: The error will be thrown into the console. Component is meant to be used only in one of these modes.

questions.question: Can I use `total` and `input` props together?
questions.answer: Yep. In v-model you'll get item number instead of page number.

tabs.title: Tabs
tabs.summaryText: The `va-tabs` component can be used as an on-page navigation offering with a rich variety of visual customizations and usage flexibility.

default.title: Default usage
default.text: By default it's displayed as a horizontal list of `va-tab` items

pagination.title: With pagination arrows
pagination.text: When wrapper width is less then tabs width, pagination arrows are shown

vertical.title: Vertical alignment
vertical.text: By using `vertical` prop alignment of `va-tabs` can be customized

stateful.title: Without value
stateful.text: Sometimes `v-model` is too much and in that case using `stateful` prop you can delegate state handling to the component itself

color.title: Color
color.text: Set different colors using the `color` prop. You can either use a theme string or the HEX color value. Inactive tabs have `inherit` color. If you need to change inactive tabs color, you can set color for va-tabs using CSS.

questions.question: How can I map content to tabs so that only specific tab content will be displayed?
questions.answer: We have this functionality in our nearest plans, but for now you could use `v-model` value to map the content yourself

fileUpload.title: File Upload
fileUpload.summaryText: The `va-file-upload` component is an input for selecting and uploading files with a richer interface than the default one.

default.title: Default usage
default.text: By default it’s displayed as a simple button to upload files.

dragAndDrop.title: Drag & Drop
dragAndDrop.text: The `dropzone` prop is used to add drag and drop possibility to the `va-file-upload` component
dragAndDrop.exampleText: This is slot, click or drag'n'drop file to upload

slots.title: Slot
slots.text: Allows to create custom file upload area.

validation.title: Specify file types
validation.text: Add `file-types` prop with allowed extensions to add file types validation

gallery.title: As gallery
gallery.text: With `type === gallery` prop you can show user picture preview of uploaded files

divider.title: Divider
divider.summaryText: The `va-divider` component is used to separate sections of lists or layouts.

default.title: Simple divider
default.text: Dividers in their simplest form display a horizontal line.

customContent.title: Custom content
customContent.text: You can customize the content on the divider line. Also you can set position of the content by setting the `orientation` property to `left`, `center` or `right`.

inset.title: Inset divider
inset.text: Add the `inset` attribute in order to set whether or not the divider is an inset divider.

vertical.title: Vertical divider
vertical.text: Add the `vertical` attribute in order to set whether or not the divider is vertically-oriented.

dashed.title: Dashed divider
dashed.text: Add the `dashed` attribute in order to set whether or not the divider line is dashed.

form.title: Form
form.summaryText: Need more advanced validation than just `type="email"` over your input elements? **`va-form`** has a solution to offer.

default.title: Default usage
default.text: All elements have `rules` prop which offers flexible solutions when it comes to elements validation. By using this prop you’ll be able to specify exact cases when the field is *valid* or *invalid*.

advanced.title: Trigger validation
advanced.text: You can trigger validation from a parent component by using the `validate()` method of the `va-form` component.

submit.title: Form submit
submit.text: You can fire the `submit` event of a `va-form` component: for this you need to set `tag="form"` to the `va-form` and have at least one inner button with `type="submit"`.

hover.title: Hover
hover.summaryText: The `va-hover` component provides easy access to hover states for any component. To work with hover states you can use either `v-model` or slot-scoped `hover` property.

slot.title: Slot based access
slot.text: You are also free to use Vue default slot.

vModel.title: Default usage
vModel.text: You can use `v-model` to get access to hover state.

questions.question: Can I wrap multiple elements with `va-hover`?
questions.answer: Yes, but they will share the hover state value.

card.title: Card
card.summaryText: The `va-card` is a multipurpose representative component that can be used for anything from links to articles. It has some helper components to make markup easier.

default.title: Default
default.text: This is default `va-card` implementation using `va-card-title`, `va-card-content` and `va-card-actions` helper components.

actions.title: Actions
actions.purpose: The `VaCardActions` component is designed to apply margins and alignment to content (`VaButtons` expected).
actions.props: Two properties can be passed: `align` (**string**, specify how to align actions) and `vertical` (**boolean**, display actions one below the other).
actions.values: Valid values for `align`: left, center, right, between, around, stretch.

questions.question: Can I use `va-card` without helper components?
questions.answer: Yes, if you don't like our styling preset, you are free to use your own.

questions.question: Should I manually set tag if i use link attributes?
questions.answer: No, we will do it for you. If tag is not set, but `href` is, component tag will be `<a>`, if any of router-link prop is set, it will be `<router-link>`.

sidebar.title: Sidebar
sidebar.summaryText: `va-sidebar` is a column to store navigation or secondary information of your app.

default.title: Default
default.text: Default usage of `va-sidebar`

minimized.title: Minimized
minimized.text: You can minimize sidebar using `minimized` prop

hoverable.title: Hoverable
hoverable.text: Manage your sidebar state using `hoverable` prop. It allows to expand 'va-sidebar' on hover.

position.title: Position
position.text: Align `va-sidebar` to the left or right.

width.title: Width
width.text: Define custom width of sidebar in maximixed state.

color.title: Color
color.text: Change background color of a sidebar.

gradient.title: Gradient background
gradient.text: You can make Navbar background gradient

questions.question: What if `minimized` conflicts with `hoverable`?
questions.answer: No conflict there, `minimized` has higher priority. If it's `true`, hover will not expand sidebar.

simple.title: Simple usage example
simple.text: `VaSidebarItem` is used with `VaSidebarContent` (to create paddings) and `VaSidebarTitle` (to fill all remaining width in `VaSidebarItem`)

colors.title: Colors
colors.text: You can change sidebar default colors

active.title: Highlight active `VaSidebarItem`
active.text: It is possible to have multiple `VaSidebarItem` highlighted. You can choose your own way to highlight an active item. Even if you want to activate a few `VaSidebarItems`.

icons.title: `VaSidebarTitle` and VaIcons
icons.text: `VaSidebarTitle` used to fill all remaining free space in `VaSidebarItem`. We can also add any other components (like `VaIcon`, `VaChip` or `VaButton`).

image.title: Image
image.summaryText: The `va-image` component is used to display responsive images. It has some features to make your work with images easier.

contain.title: Contain
contain.text: It is used to show a full image while ignoring its original ratio and size.

ratio.title: Ratio
ratio.text: Change image original ratio, show part of image to fit new ratio.

loaderSlot.title: Loader slot
loaderSlot.text: Is visible when image is loading.

errorSlot.title: Error slot
errorSlot.text: Is visible when `src` path is incorrect.

optionList.title: Option List
optionList.summaryText: The `va-option-list` component is a component to be used to group form inputs (like checkboxes and radio buttons) into a list for better control over the data.

default.title: Default
default.text: By default `va-option-list` will render list of checkboxes provided by `options` prop

withRadio.title: Radio
withRadio.text: Set `type="radio"` to display list radio buttons

withComplexData.title: Array of objects
withComplexData.text: Instead of array of strings you can provide array of objects and specify which key is for each setting.

checkbox.title: Checkbox
checkbox.summaryText: Checkboxes allow the user to select multiple options from a set.

default.title: Standard
default.text: Perfectly works with `v-model` by default.

label.title: Label
label.text: You can add a label text by setting the `label` property. You can also set the `left-label` property to move your label on the left side of a checkbox.

array.title: Grouped (Array)
array.text: Just add the same `v-model` to multiple checkboxes, and set the `array-value` prop.

error.title: Errors
error.text: You can show your error messages while using `va-checkbox` with form.

progressBar.title: Progress Bar
progressBar.summaryText: The `va-progress-bar` component is used to display an indicator of an app loading content. Also check the [va-progress-circle](/ui-elements/progress-circle) component.

default.title: Default
default.text: By default, the `va-progress-bar` displays a horizontal progress bar. Use the `value` prop to control the progress.

indeterminate.title: Indeterminate
indeterminate.text: Use the `indeterminate` prop so that the `va-progress-bar` continuously animates.

coloring.title: Coloring
coloring.text: Use predefined colors or use your own with the `color` prop.

sizing.title: Sizing
sizing.text: Use predefined sizes or use your own with the `size` prop.

slots.title: Slots
slots.text: There is also the default `slot` if you want to display some additional info about the progress.

buffer.title: Buffer
buffer.text: When dealing with media content like streaming videos we can use progress bars to show the buffering progress indicator on a video.

progressCircle.title: Progress Circle
progressCircle.summaryText: The `va-progress-circle` component is used to display an indicator of an app loading content. Also check the [va-progress-bar](/ui-elements/progress-bar) component.

default.title: Default
default.text: By default, the `va-progress-circle` displays a circular progress bar. Use the `value` prop to control the progress.

indeterminate.title: Indeterminate
indeterminate.text: Use the `indeterminate` prop so that the `va-progress-circle` continuously animates.

coloring.title: Coloring
coloring.text: Use predefined colors or use your own with the `color` prop.

sizing.title: Sizing
sizing.text: Use predefined sizes or use your own with the `size` prop.

slots.title: Slots
slots.text: There is also the default `slot` if you want to display some additional info about the progress.

thickness.title: Thickness
thickness.text: Use the `thickness` prop to adjust the stroke size.

infiniteScroll.title: Inifinite Scroll
infiniteScroll.summaryText: The `va-infinite-scroll` component is a wrapper component which is intended to be used to create lists with dynamically added content. It provides rich interface to customize scrolling behavior and much more.

default.title: Default
default.text: Just wrap your content in `va-infinite-scroll` component and provide `load` callback, and you'll see it's called each time list is scrolled till the bottom.

reverse.title: Reverse
reverse.text: With `reverse` prop you can prepend content to your list. Might be useful in messenger windows.

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.text: In case you need to prevent a list from loading more content, `disabled` prop is here for you.

customTarget.title: Custom scroll target container
customTarget.text: Provide either DOM element or CSS Selector to be used instead of default scroll container.

input.title: Input
input.summaryText: The `va-input` component is intended to be used instead of the standard HTMl input or textarea.

default.title: Basic usage
default.text: By default `va-input` doesn’t have attributes, but can be combined with a placeholder and/or label. It can also be disabled or readonly.

hint.title: Hint messages
hint.text: Support single/multi line messages to give some hint for improve UX

validate.title: Validation and error/success state
validate.text: Support a simple validation using the rules prop. The prop accepts an array of callbacks. While validating rules, the current v-model value will be passed to the callback. This callback should return either true or a String, the error message. Also you can manually pass error/success prop to manage input state.

slots.title: Slots
slots.text: You can use slots for pass custom elements to input (inner or outer), such as icons or buttons etc.

textarea.title: Textarea
textarea.text: Support a multi-line `va-input`, useful for larger amounts of text. You can make textarea auto-expandable or manually control min/max number of lines.

mask.title: Mask
mask.text: Support possibility to force/help the user to input a specific format with help from mask prop. You can pass some mask presets or custom options based on [cleave.js](https://nosir.github.io/cleave.js/)[[target=_blank]]. By default returning a raw value.

styles.title: Styles
styles.text: There are tree styles for input: Default (solid), outline, bordered.

alert.title: Alert
alert.summaryText: Alert displays an important message to attract user attention.

default.title: Default
default.text: The basic usage of the `va-alert` component.
default.prop: You read this important alert message.
default.slot: You read this important slotted alert message.

color.title: Color
color.text: Use `color` property to change the color of the component.

styles.title: Different styles
styles.text: We have 3 styles available: `color`, `outlined` and `border` styled alerts.

border.title: Border
border.text: Use the `border` property to add a strip and the `border-color` property to change the color of the strip.

title.title: Title
title.text: The `title` property allows you to write text over the description area. Use the `title` slot to costomize the title area.

dense.title: Dense
dense.text: The `dense` property reduces paddings on alert.

icon.title: Icon
icon.text: The `icon` property allows you to add an icon in front of the description area. Use the `icon` slot to costomize the icon area.

closeable.title: Closeable
closeable.text: The `closeable` property add a close alert area. Also you can pass `close-text` prop to make close icon as plain text.

center.title: Center
center.text: The `center` property allows you to center title and description areas.

misc.title: Title
misc.primary: You read this important alert message.
misc.primarySlotted: You read this important slotted alert message.
misc.success: You successfully read this important alert message.
misc.info: This alert needs your attention, but it's not super important.
misc.danger: Change a few things up and try submitting again.
misc.centered: You read this important centered alert message.
misc.icon: You read this important alert message with an icon.
misc.slottedIcon: You read this important alert message with a slotted icon.
misc.defaultCloseIcon: You read this important alert message with a default close icon.
misc.customCloseIcon: You read this important alert message with a custom close icon.
misc.messageInsteadIcon: You read this important alert message with a text instead of an icon.
misc.slottedTextInsteadIcon: You read this important alert message with a slotted text instead of an icon.

icon.title: Icon
icon.summaryText: The `va-icon` component allows you to use different icon fonts. By default Vuestic UI provides [Material Design Icons](https://fonts.google.com/icons)[[target=_blank]].

default.title: Default
default.text: Basic usage of the component with different icon fonts.

color.title: Color
color.text: Set different colors using the `color` prop. You can either use a theme string or the HEX color value.

size.title: Size
size.text: Apply the `size` prop in order to make `va-icon` fit your needs.

rotation.title: Rotation and Flip
rotation.text: It is used to rotate and mirror the `va-icon` component.

spin.title: Spin
spin.text: You can add animation of rotation of the icon using the property `spin`.

text.title: Text as icon
text.text: Using `text` prop is used to cover the text icon style.

tag.title: Custom tag
tag.text: With the `tag` prop you can attach the icon to another tag.

radio.title: Radio
radio.summaryText: The `va-radio` allows the user to select one option from a set.

default.title: Default
default.text: Default usage  of the `va-radio` component.

color.title: Colors
color.text: With `color` prop you can change the color of the component.

customLabels.title: Custom Labels
customLabels.text: You can add a label text by setting the `label` property. To switch label side use `left-label` property.

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.text: With `disabled` prop you can disable a user interaction  with `va-radio` component.

default.title: Default
default.text: Default usage  of the `va-collapse` component.

solid.title: Solid
solid.text: Add borders to your collapse component by using the `solid` property.

icon.title: Icon
icon.text: You can add an icon to the header.

accordion.title: Accordion
accordion.summaryText: Allows you to control group of [collapses](ui-elements/collapse).

default.title: Default
default.text: Default usage  of the `va-accordion` component.

multiply.title: Multiply
multiply.text: Accordion component allows you to select multiply collapses.

chip.title: Chip
chip.summaryText: Chip - it is a compact element for displaying data or performing an action.

default.title: Default
default.text: Default usage of the `va-chip` component.

flat.title: Flat
flat.text: Flat style without borders and background.

color.title: Color
color.text: You can use the `va-chip` component with different colors.

size.title: Size
size.text: Set different tag sizes using size presets.

icon.title: Icon
icon.text: You can use icons in tag.

closeable.title: Closeable
closeable.text: A tag can be closed by applying the `closeable` property.

grid.title: Grid System
grid.summaryText: Vuestic UI provides you with some flexbox helper classes. Of course, you can opt out using CSS Grid instead (or any other layout-scheme you'd like), but if you prefer using flexbox, we've got you covered. Still, the final decision is totally up to you.

breakpoints.title: Breakpoints
breakpoints.text: Use the following classes (`breakpoints`) to apply provided styling to screens of certain widths exclusively.

offsets.title: Offsets
offsets.text: You can use the `offset`-classes to set spaces between a given element and the one to the left from it.

gutters.title: Gutters
gutters.text: Set the margins between the "`cell`s" of you flex-container with the `gutter` classes.

align.title: `align`:
variants: `.align--start` - cross-start margin edge of the items is placed on the cross-start line
`.align--end` - cross-end margin edge of the items is placed on the cross-end line
`.align--center` - items are centered in the cross-axis
`.align--baseline` - items are aligned the way their baselines align

alignSelf.title: `align-self`:
variants: `.align-self--start` - cross-start margin edge of the items is placed on the cross-start line
`.align-self--end` - cross-end margin edge of the items is placed on the cross-end line
`.align-self--center` - items are centered in the cross-axis
`.align-self--baseline` - items are aligned the way their baselines align

alignContent.title: `align-content`:
variants: `.align-content--start` - lines packed to the start of the container
`.align-content--end` - lines packed to the end of the container
`.align-content--center` - lines packed to the center of the container
`.align-content--space-between` - lines evenly distributed; the first line is at the start of the container while the last one is at the end
`.align-content--space-around` - lines evenly distributed with equal space between them

justify.title: `justify`:
variants: `.justify--start` - items are packed toward the start line
`.justify--end` - items are packed toward to end line
`.justify--center` - items are centered along the line
`.justify--space-around` - items are evenly distributed in the line, items have equal space around on either end
`.justify--space-between` - items are evenly distributed in the line; first item is on the start line, last item is on the end line
`.justify--space-evenly` - items are evenly distributed in the line; items have equal space around them

justifySelf.title: `justify-self`:
variants: `.justify-self--start` - The item is packed flush to each other toward the start edge of the alignment container in the appropriate axis.
`.justify-self--end` - The item is packed flush to each other toward the end edge of the alignment container in the appropriate axis.
`.justify-self--center` - For items that are not children of a flex container, this value is treated as `.justify-self--start`.
`.justify-self--baseline` - The items are aligned according to baselines

list.title: List
list.summaryText: The `va-list` component is used to display structured information.

default.title: Basic usage
default.text: Has no attributes by default. Build a structure by using components `va-list-label`, `va-list-separator`, `va-list-item` and etc.

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.text: You can disable any user interaction by using 'disabled' prop.

clickable.title: Clickable
clickable.text: Support a ability to use a list item as a link.

fit.title: Fit
fit.text: Support a fitting of the list item by its content length.

lines.title: Lines
lines.text: You can divide item label content on a custom count of lines.

select.title: Select
select.summaryText: Select field components are used for collecting user provided information from a list of options. This component opens up a menu for the selection list and action.

trackBy.title: Track by
trackBy.text: Track by can be used if you have multiple options with same value.

slots.title: Slots
text: The content of the `content` slot replaces the `input` element in the component.

state.title: State
state.text: Includes error, success, disabled or loading state

searchable.title: Searchable
searchable.text: Supports ability to filter option list by typing

allowCreate.title: Allow create
allowCreate.text: You can add options that initial options do not have

validation.title: Validation rules
validation.text: Select accepts an array of functions that take an input value as an argument and return either true / false or a string with an error message

keyboardNavigation.title: Keyboard navigation
keyboardNavigation.moves: By using `ARROW DOWN` and `ARROW UP` you can move between options
keyboardNavigation.selects: By using `ENTER` and `SPACE` you can select current option
keyboardNavigation.hints: If you type while option list is opened this will create a search buffer (will reset if you do not type for 1 second) that will be used to search in the options labels

styles.title: Styles
styles.text: Select styles inherit from input styles

parallax.title: Parallax
parallax.summaryText: Parallax (`va-parallax`) is a component where the background image is moved at a different speed than the foreground content while scrolling.

default.title: Default
default.text: A block with a background image is displayed by default. You need to pass the `src` property.

custom.title: Custom height and speed
custom.text: You can adjust parallax `height` and scroll `speed`. Attention, the scrolling speed depends on the ratio of the parallax height to the image height.

reversed.title: Reversed
reversed.text: You can flip the parallax scrolling.

slot.title: Slot
slot.text: You can provide some kind of content over the parallax.

backtop.title: Backtop
backtop.summaryText: The backtop button is used to return to the top of a component.

default.title: Basic usage
default.text: By default `va-backtop` watches for a body element offset height. You can change a target element, positioning and scrolling speed.

reset.title: CSS Reset
reset.description: We use `reset.scss` to reset and normalize basic CSS styles

features.title: Reset features
features.info: Below is a list of features that are provided by reset.scss:
features.list:
* Margin and padding reset. 
 * Border reset. 
 * Hide quotes. 
 * Font reset. 
 * Hidden-attribute fix for newer browsers. 
 * HTML5 display-role reset for older browsers
features.more: For a complete list of all applied styles, see the [reset.scss](https://github.com/epicmaxco/vuestic-ui/blob/develop/packages/ui/src/styles/global/reset.scss)[[target=_blank]] stylesheet.

colorInput.title: Color Input
colorInput.summaryText: Input component that allows you to select a color.

default.title: Basic usage
default.text: By default use this component with `v-model`.

disabled.title: Disabled
disabled.text: All user interactions can be disabled.

default.title: Basic usage
default.text: By default use this component with `v-model` and palette array.

indicator.title: Indicator
indicator.text: You can apply different styles to the indicator: `dot` and `square` are available.

datePicker.title: Date Picker
datePicker.description:
Date picker component allows user to select single, multiple or range of dates, months and years. You can customize it the way you want. There is a option to change all string and formats.
